intro: Erigeron commixtus, commonly known as the mixed fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, meadows, and disturbed soils. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron commixtus is often found in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny environments.
